page.title: 14Changing Times
page.content: {Fifty years ago}in this area there was no main water.{Water}was taken from a {well}or some people had a{water pump. Today everyone has a mains water supply. There was no mains{sewerage, the{lavatory}was in a shed in the back garden. It would be a bucket which had to be emptied in the garden. Most people kept the same piece of ground to do this. Today we all have either mains sewerage or a septic tank. Mains {electricity}was only in the centre of the village and so people used a boiler in their washhouse for washing and an iron, which was heated on a fire. Light was often supplied by {paraffin lamps.}Today everyone has electricity and some houses have gas supplies.{Heating}of houses was by open coal fires. Today many houses in tne area have central heating.
